title: 'Deshdrohis trying to protect infiltrators': PM Modi defends SIR at Assam rally

title: BMC polls: Congress decides to go solo; Uddhav‚ÄìRaj bonhomie strains MVA
content: The Congress party has announced it will contest the upcoming Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) elections independently. This decision comes as Uddhav Thackeray's Shiv Sena (UBT) and Raj Thackeray's MNS appear to be aligning, potentially to protect the Thackeray political legacy. The MVA alliance, which includes Congress, faced a significant defeat in the 2024 Maharashtra Assembly elections.

title: Social media ban: Can India mirror Aus model? Promise, pitfalls, and practicality
content: Australia has enacted a law prohibiting social media use for those under 16, a move sparking global debate. While parents largely support it, youth oppose it. India faces similar discussions, with challenges in implementing a ban due to its vast population and digital integration.

title: 'Attack on interests of poor': Sonia Gandhi slams PM Modi over VB-G RAM G Bill
content: Congress leader Sonia Gandhi has strongly criticized Prime Minister Narendra Modi's government. She claims the new VB-G RAM G Bill replaces MGNREGA and harms the poor. The government states the new law improves upon MGNREGA, which it says was plagued by corruption. The opposition protested the bill's passage in Parliament.

title: ‚ÄòI finish them,‚Äô says Elon Musk as Delaware Supreme Court restores Tesla pay deal
content: The Delaware Supreme Court has reinstated Elon Musk's $56 billion pay package, overturning a lower court's decision. The court found that canceling the compensation was an inequitable remedy, leaving Musk uncompensated for his six years of work. This ruling affirms the enforceability of the deal, now valued at $139 billion.

title: Why Shubman Gill missed out on T20 World Cup 2026 selection: Ajit Agarkar breaks silence
content: Shubman Gill has been excluded from India's T20 World Cup squad due to his recent lack of form. Axar Patel has been appointed vice-captain, while Ishan Kishan returns as the second wicketkeeper and reserve opener. Rinku Singh is back as the designated finisher.

title: ‚ÄòYou are wrong‚Äô: Former ASML engineer build EUV machine; contradicts CEO‚Äôs timeline
content: China has reportedly built a working prototype of an advanced chip-making machine, defying Western predictions.  Former ASML engineers are said to be behind the project, which aims for semiconductor independence. This development, a six-year government initiative, could significantly alter global chip supply chains, challenging ASML's monopoly on crucial EUV technology.

title: T20 World Cup squad: Captain Suryakumar speaks up on his form; remarks after Gill's omission
content: Ahead of the T20 World Cup, selectors dropped Shubman Gill, prioritizing impact players and quick starts. Ishan Kishan and Rinku Singh return, while captain Suryakumar Yadav, despite recent lean form, expressed confidence in his batting resurgence. The team aims for stronger performances from its leader as they prepare to defend their title.

title: 'Mistaken for Bangladeshi national': Dalit man beaten to death in Kerala; probe under way
content: A Dalit migrant worker from Chhattisgarh, Ramnarayan Baghel, was tragically beaten to death in Kerala's Palakkad district. Initial reports suggest he was mistaken for a Bangladeshi national and possibly a thief after a local incident. Five arrests have been made as police investigate the brutal mob violence that has left his family devastated and sparked fear among migrant communities.

title: Guwahati airport gets new terminal: PM Modi inaugurates the project - see stunning pics
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated Guwahati's new nature-themed airport terminal, designed with local bamboo and inspired by Assam's biodiversity.

title: ‚ÄòAmazon is bad at copying rivals‚Äô: CEO makes rare admission - what it means for AI era
content: AWS CEO Matt Garman admitted the company struggles with copying competitors, preferring to innovate from first principles to solve customer problems.  Meanwhile, AWS reported a 20% revenue increase in Q3 2025, exceeding expectations and driven by strong demand in AI and core infrastructure, with significant capital expenditures allocated to AI projects.

title: Chat cart: When your tandoori naan & tikka aren‚Äôt smoky, but everything else is
content: Winters in Delhi once meant a sensory delight of seasonal foods, from makke ki roti to halwa. However, recent years have brought deadly pollution, replacing aromatic food whiffs with the smell of burning and health concerns. Despite this, foodies still brave the smog to savor traditional street food, though conversations now revolve around pollution and sore throats.

title: Jharkhand horror: Drunk army jawan 'rapes' woman inside train; accused arrested
content: An Army jawan on duty was arrested in Ranchi for allegedly raping a 22-year-old woman at Tatisilwai Railway Station. The 42-year-old soldier, reportedly inebriated, took the woman to an empty train coach and committed the assault. He was apprehended after bystanders raised an alarm.

title: 'Dhurandhar' box office collection day 16: Ranveer Singh, Akshaye Khanna starrer eyes Rs 500 cr mark
content: Ranveer Singh's 'Dhurandhar' continues its box office dominance, entering its third week with over Rs. 480 crore. The spy thriller is projected to surpass Rs. 500 crore by Saturday, even amidst competition from 'Avatar: Fire and Ash'. The film has shown impressive growth since its massive opening, based on true incidents.

title: 'Who will bring murderers to justice?' B'desh author says mob pounced on Hindu man 'like hyenas'
content: A Hindu garment worker named Dipu Chandra Das was brutally killed by a mob in Bangladesh. He was accused of blasphemy. The incident occurred in Bhaluka, Mymensingh. Authorities have arrested seven individuals in connection with the lynching. This event has raised serious concerns about the safety of religious minorities in the country.

title: Augusta Westland deal: Christian Michel released in PMLA case; remains in CBI custody
content: A Delhi court on Saturday ordered the release of Christian Michel James from custody in the Augusta Westland money laundering case, as he has served the maximum statutory sentence. While released from the PMLA case, Michel will remain in custody for the related CBI case.

title: Choking saga! To escape toxic air, Delhiites clog Manali town; 15,000 vehicles in 15 days
content: Manali is experiencing severe traffic jams as thousands of tourists, many from Delhi, flock to the region for Christmas and New Year. Daily vehicle influx exceeds 1,000, causing significant congestion on key routes. Authorities are prioritizing traffic management with increased police deployment and a planned traffic strategy.

title: Court will always lean towards animals who suffer silently: Supreme Court
content: The Supreme Court has signaled its strong inclination to protect elephants, stating it will always favor animals whose migration paths are obstructed by commercial tourism. This stance emerged during hearings concerning wildlife resorts in Tamil Nadu's Sigur Plateau elephant corridor. The court emphasized that any doubt regarding benefit should go to the silent victims of development.

title: Quote of the day by Sigmund Freud: 'A man should not strive to eliminate‚Ä¶'
content: Famous Austrian neurologist Sigmund Freud completely changed the way we look at the human mind by discovering psychoanalysis. It was a talking therapy for mental issues rooted in unconscious thoughts which people fail to realize and accept.  His  famous book "Interpretation of Dreams" said that dreams reveal hidden desires of human beings.

title: 'Rs 30 lakh to take image with Messi‚Äô: Kolkata police raid organiser Satadru Dutta‚Äôs house
content: Authorities investigating the Lionel Messi event's mismanagement raided chief organizer Satadru Dutta's home, uncovering a lavish residence with a pool and soccer ground. The probe has broadened beyond crowd control to suspected Rs 100 crore financial irregularities, including unaccounted cash for photos with Messi and opaque ticket sales, suggesting deliberate financial impropriety.

title: General degree vs. Honours degree: What matters more in today's job market?
content: Indian students often favour honours degrees, but the job market is shifting. Employers now prioritize practical skills, internships, and problem-solving over degree labels. While honours degrees offer depth for academic or specialized careers, general degrees provide flexibility. Ultimately, preparedness and demonstrable abilities, not just the degree title, determine employability in today's economy.

title: Epstein files opened: From steamy photos to call logs ‚Äî What's in them and what is still missing
content: The Department of Justice released thousands of files related to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, but a substantial portion remains unpublished. Congress had set a December 19 deadline for the release, and while some documents are now accessible, many are heavily redacted or previously public, drawing criticism from lawmakers.

title: Gurgaon horror: Auto driver kidnaps two minor girls, rapes child; assailant jumps off flyover
content: An auto driver kidnapped two minor sisters, sexually assaulting the elder one in Manesar. A passerby alerted police, leading to a chase. The accused jumped from a flyover, sustaining leg fractures, and was apprehended. He faces charges under the POCSO Act.

title: World Bank funding boost for Pakistan: $700m tranche approved under multi-phase plan
content: The World Bank has approved $700 million in fresh financing for Pakistan to bolster macroeconomic stability and enhance public service delivery. This funding, part of a larger $1.35 billion program, will support federal initiatives and a provincial project in Sindh, signaling continued multilateral support despite governance concerns.

title: 'It's not about form': Surya reveals real reason for Gill's omission from T20 World Cup squad
content: Shubman Gill's T20 World Cup squad exclusion sparks debate, with captain Suryakumar Yadav citing team combination and the need for a top-order keeper.  The decision prioritizes balance over individual form, impacting other batting selections as India aims to retain their title.

title: From Eisenhower to Trump: How US presidents shaped the Kennedy Center
content: The Kennedy Center has unveiled new signage, officially renaming it The Donald J. Trump and The John F. Kennedy Memorial Center for the Performing Arts following a unanimous board vote. This change comes amidst an investigation into the center's leadership over allegations of cronyism and corruption.

title: Lab assistant dies after 'snakebite'; sons plotted murder for Rs 3-cr insurance
content: A chilling murder plot unfolded in Tiruvallur district where two sons allegedly orchestrated their father's death by snakebite to claim ‚Çπ3 crore in insurance.  Initially ruled accidental, the investigation revealed a staged second bite by a krait after a previous cobra incident. Six individuals, including the sons, have been arrested.

title: Infosys stock shock! Why did ADRs jump nearly 40% in minutes on NYSE? Explained
content: US-listed Infosys shares surged nearly 40% in minutes, briefly adding billions to its market value and triggering a NYSE trading halt due to extreme volatility.  The rapid, unexplained rally, occurring during low liquidity, is being attributed to a potential short squeeze or a data error mislabeling the ticker.

title: 'Lenient' punishment: Former Pak PM Imran, wife Bibi sentenced to 17 yrs in prison
content: Former Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan and his wife Bushra Bibi have been sentenced to 17 years in prison each in the Toshakhana corruption case. The verdict, delivered by an accountability court, pertains to alleged fraud involving state gifts received from the Saudi government in 2021. Both were fined Rs 10 million.

title: Hindu man lynched, body burnt in Bangladesh; 7 arrested
content: Seven arrests were made after a Hindu youth was beaten to death and his body set ablaze in Bangladesh's Mymensingh district following blasphemy allegations. The victim, Dipu Chandra Das, was accused of making derogatory comments. This incident follows the recent killing of student leader Sharif Osman Hadi, sparking renewed unrest and political instability.

title: 'Lane is for staff, are you anpadh': Argument at Delhi airport escalates into physical assault
content: An Air India Express pilot has been grounded after allegedly assaulting a passenger at Delhi Airport's Terminal 1. The altercation began when the pilot questioned a passenger using a staff lane, escalating into a physical confrontation. The passenger claims he was left with a bloodied face and his daughter traumatized. An inquiry is underway.

title: 'I feel distracted when kids play on road': Ex-gym trainer assaults multiple children in Bengaluru
content: A former gym trainer, Ranjan M, has been accused by parents in Thyagarajanagar of targeting several children with bike incidents and physical assaults. The most serious case involved a five-year-old boy who was kicked while playing. Police confirm Ranjan appears mentally unstable and is undergoing treatment, having confessed to the assaults due to agitation from children playing.

title: 'Serious violation': Pakistan hockey team manager caught smoking on aircraft; barred from flight
content: Pakistan hockey Olympian Anjum Saeed faces controversy. He was reportedly caught smoking on a plane in Rio de Janeiro. This led to him and a player being offloaded. Saeed claims personal work in Dubai. Officials dispute this. The Pakistan Sports Board has ordered an inquiry. The incident reflects poorly on Pakistan sport.

title: Assam tragedy: Rajdhani Express hits herd of elephants, killing 8; engine, 5 coaches derail
content: Eight elephants tragically died after being struck by the Sairang New Delhi Rajdhani Express in Assam's Hojai district early Saturday. The collision caused five coaches and the engine of the train to derail, though no passengers were injured. The incident occurred in a forested area known for elephant movement.

title: Dense fog in Delhi: Over 100 flights cancelled at IGI Airport
content: Dense fog disrupted flight operations at Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport on Saturday, leading to over 100 cancellations. The national capital also experienced a deterioration in air quality, with the AQI reaching 384 in the 'very poor' category, blanketing the city in toxic smog.

title: Watch: US strikes over 70 targets in Syria; calls it 'declaration of vengeance'
content: US launched a major military operation in Syria. Over seventy Islamic State targets were hit with more than one hundred precision munitions. This action follows the recent killing of two American personnel in a December 13 attack. ‚ÄãTrump said the strikes were part of "Operation Hawkeye Strike" and warned any group threatening Americans of severe consequences.

title: Fossil fuel peak demand pushed to 2030s as oil rebounds; India emerges as growth engine
content: Global oil demand reversed its predicted decline in 2025, with India emerging as a major consumption driver. This resurgence was fueled by delayed clean energy policies and geopolitical tensions, while India diversified its oil imports, notably from Russia, and expanded refining capacity. Stable oil prices provided fiscal relief for importers like India.

title: Goa nightclub fire: Cops initiate process for blue corner notice against Surinder Kumar Khosla
content: Goa Police are initiating the process to issue a Blue Corner Notice against British national Surinder Kumar Khosla, an accused in the December 6 nightclub fire that killed 25. Khosla, believed to be a co-owner of the nightclub, was present in Goa during the incident and reportedly fled to the UK the following day.

title: India‚Äôs telecom sector surges in 2025! 5G rollout reaches 85% of population
content: India's telecom sector concluded 2025 with significant advancements in digital connectivity and infrastructure. The National Broadband Mission 2.0 accelerated high-speed internet access nationwide, while 5G services now reach nearly the entire population. A major achievement includes developing indigenous 4G technology, bolstering India's self-reliance and manufacturing capabilities.

title: First playoff Brawl of the Wild headlines FCS semifinal showdowns
content: a crowd of 27,340 watched Montana State play keep-away four weeks ago . the Grizzlies had just cut Montana State's lead to 31-28 with seven minutes remaining . but the visiting Bobcats moved the chains five times, including on fourth-and-1 and third-and-4 .

title: Power Rankings: Louisville in, UNC out of top 16
content: this week they make their debut in the ESPN women's college basketball Power Rankings . the Cardinals are now no. 16, the highest-ranked of the three ACC teams left in the AP poll . they play the Tennessee Lady Vols in Saturday's champions Classic doubleheader at barclays center .

title: Connelly on the CFP first round: Game-by-game previews
content: the first round of last year's inaugural 12-team college football playoff was memorable primarily for the otherworldly atmospheres . the four home teams were favored by an average of 8.8 points but won by 19.3 . we might get a couple of those this time around, too .

title: Premier League Future Power Rankings: Long-term projections for all 20 teams
content: clubs don't function in this way, or at least they shouldn't . they're signing players, developing talent, and acquiring coaches with a multi-year view into the future . if everyone only cared about this season, every player in the league would be 27 years-old .

title: 'I wish he was still here': Inside Klay Thompson's split from Golden State
content: Curry says it's a "natural instinct" for his eyes to follow Klay Thompson around the court . his son, Canon, delivered his "Hello, Klay" line that became a viral video representing the Splash Brother connection . he was resting at home with Canon, who is now 7 years old and slightly more aware of the complexities of the NBA world .

title: Facts vs. Feelings: Bo Nix and six other potential playoff heroes
content: the spectacle of the ring and the vibrant characters that bring it to life loom large over the zeitgeist . it's testament to brilliant marketing, engaging storytelling and continued commitment to craft . xFP leaderboard | xTD leaderboard .

title: NHL Power Rankings: Updated 1-32 poll, holiday gifts for each team
content: the Colorado Avalanche remain on top of the ESPN NHL Power Rankings . it's the holiday gifting season, which means what better time than now to hand out a gift to all 32 teams . a panel of commentators, analysts, reporters and editors send in a 1-32 poll based on the games through Wednesday .

title: Trump 'saves' Kennedy Center after 50 years of successful concerts by adding his name to it
content: the board of trustees of the John F Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts in Washington DC voted to rename the Trump-Kennedy Center . the name change was reportedly initiated by former white house personnel director and currently US ambassador to India Sergio Gor .

title: Goa: 18 months after NGT order, Curlies sealed for violations
content: officials plan to conduct detailed mapping before demolishing portions that encroach into CRZ areas . the popular party venue, known for its all-night rave parties, has been under authorities‚Äô scrutiny for over a decade . GCZMA officials clarified that the action was due to alleged violations of Coastal Regulatory Zone norms .

title: Fight results: Joshua stops Paul in Round 6, Baumgardner wins
content: Anthony Joshua stopped him at the Kaseya Center in florida on friday . he was originally scheduled to meet lightweight champion Gervonta "Tank" Davis . the event was canceled after a civil suit was filed against Davis in late October . Joshua lost the WBO, IBF and WBA titles to Tommy Fury .

title: Down 17-0, Tide 'keep fighting' to stun Sooners
content: the no. 9 Crimson Tide beats no. 8 Oklahoma 34-24 in the college football playoff . they trailed by at least 10 points, including all three defeats this season . the rematch might have signaled a long-awaited breakthrough .

title: CFP first-round takeaways: OU's special teams collapses, and momentum swings for Bama
